current_task.title: Create useMatrixAuth hook
current_task.description:
Create client/src/hooks/useMatrixAuth.js for Matrix authentication operations.

The hook should provide:
1. loginAsGuest() - Register as guest user, auto-generate display name from localStorage 'hush_displayName'
2. login(username, password) - Login with Matrix credentials (for future use)
3. register(username, password, displayName) - Register new Matrix account (for future use)
4. logout() - Logout and cleanup Matrix client
5. State management: isAuthenticated, isLoading, error, userId, accessToken, deviceId

For the Hush use case, guest authentication is the primary flow. When a user creates or joins a room, they should be auto-authenticated as a Matrix guest. The guest's display name should come from the displayName they enter in the Home.jsx form.

Use the matrixClient singleton from matrixClient.js. Follow the hook pattern established in useDevices.js:
- Use useState for state management
- Use useCallback for memoized functions
- Export named function (not default)

Matrix guest registration endpoint: client.registerGuest({ initial_device_display_name })
The guest registration returns: { user_id, access_token, device_id }
acceptance_criteria: Hook returns: { loginAsGuest, login, register, logout, isAuthenticated, isLoading, error, userId, accessToken, deviceId }
loginAsGuest() calls matrixClient.registerGuest() with display name from localStorage
loginAsGuest() stores credentials and starts client sync after registration
logout() calls destroyMatrixClient() and clears auth state
isAuthenticated is true only when userId and accessToken are present
error state captures and exposes registration/login failures
All functions are memoized with useCallback
